title: How to Make Shrimp Soup

steps.headline: Heat the butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
steps.description: Add the carrots and onions as the butter melts, and sauté them for 4-5 minutes or until the vegetables begin to soften.

steps.headline: Add the flour to the pan and whisk.
steps.description: After about one minute, add the milk, potatoes, and dissolved bouillon cubes.

steps.headline: Cook all of the ingredients for 15 minutes, keeping the flame on medium.
steps.description: The potatoes should be softened and slightly mushy.

steps.headline: Remove the pan from heat.
steps.description: Stir in the half-and half, salt, and pepper, and set aside.

steps.headline: Pour two cups of water into a separate saucepan.
steps.description: Sprinkle in some salt, and then bring the water to a boil.

steps.headline: Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the shrimp has turned pink.
steps.description: Remove the pan from heat and drain. The shrimp should be slightly undercooked when finished.

steps.headline: Allow the shrimp to cool slightly and then peel and chop each piece on a cutting board.
Add the chunks of shrimp to the soup and stir all of the ingredients together.
Enjoy the soup hot.
steps.description: Serve with a slice of toasted sourdough bread.

text: Hearty Shrimp and Potato Soup Heat the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the carrots and onions as the butter melts, and sauté them for 4-5 minutes or until the vegetables begin to soften. Add the flour to the pan and whisk. After about one minute, add the milk, potatoes, and dissolved bouillon cubes. Cook all of the ingredients for 15 minutes, keeping the flame on medium. The potatoes should be softened and slightly mushy. Remove the pan from heat. Stir in the half-and half, salt, and pepper, and set aside. Pour two cups of water into a separate saucepan. Sprinkle in some salt, and then bring the water to a boil. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the shrimp has turned pink. Remove the pan from heat and drain. The shrimp should be slightly undercooked when finished. Allow the shrimp to cool slightly and then peel and chop each piece on a cutting board.  Add the chunks of shrimp to the soup and stir all of the ingredients together.  Enjoy the soup hot. Serve with a slice of toasted sourdough bread. Coconut-Ginger Shrimp Soup Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the ginger, pepper flakes, and garlic, and cook for about one minute, stirring occasionally. Add the coconut milk, carrots, and 3 cups of water to the saucepan. Mix well. Combine the cornstarch and two tablespoons of water in a small bowl. Spoon this mixture into the pot and mix well. Bring the ingredients in the saucepan to a boil. Break the angel hair pasta in half and add it to the pot. Reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer for 4-5 minutes. The pasta should be cooked al dente and the carrots slightly tender. Add the shrimp to the pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp is pink and opaque. Remove the pot from heat. Stir in the lime juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.
